item.description:
Legal Issues around Online Publishing and Internet Marketing.

Sometimes it seems like the online world is the wild west and anything out there is fair game.  Photos are ‘borrowed’ in all too many websites, videos pirated, and copy is fair game as well.  Well, that’s not quite the case and we’d like to share with our members what they need to know to help protect themselves and their content.    

This Meetup emerged from our Rapid E-Book Publishing Course as many members recounted adventures and mishaps and many questions came up around what was OK or Not OK in online publishing and internet marketing.  A number of stories  arose about member adventures and troubles in the legal space….so  here we are in November and ready to share some best practices and do’s & don’ts.

We've put together a panel of experienced practitioners in the legal, photo and video communities who will share some basic tips, strategies and real world experiences.

BIMM welcomes:

Joshua Jarvis, Foley Hoag LLP

Clark Linehan, Linehan Photography

Andrew Penziner, Andrew Penziner Productions LLC

Some topics that were mentioned:

Fair Use & Fair Dealing

Creative Commons

When does sharing become stealing?

Getting Permissions

What to do if you’ve been ‘infringed’?

If time permits, we may touch on Content ID, Authorship Markup and Plagiarism Checkers.

We'll also do our usual after Meetup Meetup at one of the cool local food & drink venues so please join us & continue the conversations - Lew, Bruce & Keith
